title: >>> The "WET WAR" that Wasn't
body_text:
Season 11 "Double Main Event"
Legend vs. Rookie
The warriors of Wall High School journey through the times yet again ...
The Road to CX
. And on this final stop, hell was damn sure to break loose. Big time player
Ryan Letsche
looked to take down the blocking magician in his debut match-up,
Justin Wolf
.
There was nothing fancy about this main event as the team generals were pumped and rarin' to go, each possessing the physical stamina and drive to outwit, outplay, and outlast their adversary. To "survive" is what it's all about.
Wolf struck first with a clean win in Game 1. The "rimshot king" would rebound quickly however, tying the confrontation. Team LETSCHE would rack up yet another in the win column, going up a point on his "magic" fiend. But following the dominating performance in Game 4, Team WOLF had received just about all of the punishment they would allow. The savage beatings toward Team LETSCHE began without remorse and would unfortunately prolong into the late night hours.
Flash Results by Game
: 1, 4, 5, 6, 7 (Wolf); 2, 3 (Letsche)
Though the score may not reflect it, it was a hard-fought, well-earned victory for the rookie captain. The dodgeball community can only expect great things from this all-star.
Wolf defeated Letsche, 5 to 2.
Moments & Stars
: Justin Pierce's overall longevity in a majority of the games; the mid-air bulletball collison by Kevin Fitzpatrick and Alison Bertsch; Halloween costums Chris "Axel Rose" Adams and Kevin "Gorilla" Fitzpatrick; Justin Wolf's numerous "football spikes" after being eliminated
RECORDS
> Attendance: 20
> Notable Returns: Lauren Winston and Valerie Winston (Last competed at DODGEBALL 106)
> New Players: (0)*
- DODGEBALL 109 was not a
Wet War
, despite heavy rains soaking the area in the days leading to the event. This was the 18th straight event without the wet weather.
- *This was the first event in nearly seven months that didn't feature any new talent. The last event that was "veterans-only" was DODGEBALL 82 in early April 2007.
- Captains newbie Justin Wolf defeated the experienced Ryan Letsche in the first half of the Season 11 "Double Main Event" by a score of 5 to 2. The loss put Letsche's record at 2-4-0. This was the first event to feature a standard captains match since the heated
Avakian/Londono
war at DODGEBALL 106.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Season 11 Finale
DODGEBALL CX
November 3, 2007
Special Start Time: 6pm
Finally
, the two most titanic couples perhaps in the history of the game clash in a never-before-witnessed blockbuster. Since the shocking announcement at DODGEBALL 106, there isn't any doubt this encounter will be epic.
So much is on the line in this team brawl as all four competitors are making their ten event captains debut, and deservingly so.
Mike "Sputz" Krott
the catching icon himself, teams with the beautiful bad-ass
Melissa Kerr
. Powerhouse titan
Alison Bertsch
and the athletically-gifted
Mike Butler
stand in their way.
Divide and Conquer
won't work in this one.
Which iconic twosome will take seat to the "King and Queen" throne?
The first season finale in Year 3 ... Watch history unfold before your very eyes November 3. The action begins at the special start time of
6pm
.
body_html:
Season 11 "Double Main Event"
Legend vs. Rookie

The warriors of Wall High School journey through the times yet again ... The Road to CX. And on this final stop, hell was damn sure to break loose. Big time player Ryan Letsche looked to take down the blocking magician in his debut match-up, Justin Wolf.

There was nothing fancy about this main event as the team generals were pumped and rarin' to go, each possessing the physical stamina and drive to outwit, outplay, and outlast their adversary. To "survive" is what it's all about.

Wolf struck first with a clean win in Game 1. The "rimshot king" would rebound quickly however, tying the confrontation. Team LETSCHE would rack up yet another in the win column, going up a point on his "magic" fiend. But following the dominating performance in Game 4, Team WOLF had received just about all of the punishment they would allow. The savage beatings toward Team LETSCHE began without remorse and would unfortunately prolong into the late night hours.

Flash Results by Game: 1, 4, 5, 6, 7 (Wolf); 2, 3 (Letsche)

Though the score may not reflect it, it was a hard-fought, well-earned victory for the rookie captain. The dodgeball community can only expect great things from this all-star.

Wolf defeated Letsche, 5 to 2.

Moments & Stars: Justin Pierce's overall longevity in a majority of the games; the mid-air bulletball collison by Kevin Fitzpatrick and Alison Bertsch; Halloween costums Chris "Axel Rose" Adams and Kevin "Gorilla" Fitzpatrick; Justin Wolf's numerous "football spikes" after being eliminated

RECORDS
> Attendance: 20
> Notable Returns: Lauren Winston and Valerie Winston (Last competed at DODGEBALL 106)
> New Players: (0)*

- DODGEBALL 109 was not a Wet War, despite heavy rains soaking the area in the days leading to the event. This was the 18th straight event without the wet weather.
- *This was the first event in nearly seven months that didn't feature any new talent. The last event that was "veterans-only" was DODGEBALL 82 in early April 2007.
- Captains newbie Justin Wolf defeated the experienced Ryan Letsche in the first half of the Season 11 "Double Main Event" by a score of 5 to 2. The loss put Letsche's record at 2-4-0. This was the first event to feature a standard captains match since the heated Avakian/Londono war at DODGEBALL 106.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

Season 11 Finale
DODGEBALL CX
November 3, 2007
Special Start Time: 6pm



Finally, the two most titanic couples perhaps in the history of the game clash in a never-before-witnessed blockbuster. Since the shocking announcement at DODGEBALL 106, there isn't any doubt this encounter will be epic.

So much is on the line in this team brawl as all four competitors are making their ten event captains debut, and deservingly so. Mike "Sputz" Krott the catching icon himself, teams with the beautiful bad-ass Melissa Kerr. Powerhouse titan Alison Bertsch and the athletically-gifted Mike Butler stand in their way. Divide and Conquer won't work in this one.

Which iconic twosome will take seat to the "King and Queen" throne?

The first season finale in Year 3 ... Watch history unfold before your very eyes November 3. The action begins at the special start time of 6pm.
